"I think our classroom should adopt a class pet, such as a fish or a hamster. Caring for a pet would teach us responsibility because we would take turns feeding it and cleaning its home. Watching the animal explore and play would also help us feel calm during stressful test days. Some parents may worry about allergies, but we can choose a hypoallergenic pet and keep its cage in a corner away from desks. ________"

answer_options.A: For these reasons, adopting a class pet will teach us responsibility and help us relax, making it a smart choice for our classroom.
answer_options.B: In conclusion, having a pet to care for and watch would bring many great benefits to our class.
answer_options.C: Therefore, we should ask the principal if we can visit the science lab to see the animals there instead.
answer_options.D: That is why hypoallergenic animals are the best choice for schools with allergy concerns.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it restates the opinion (adopting a class pet), summarizes both key reasons presented in the paragraph (learning responsibility and feeling calm during tests), and provides a clear sense of closure to the argument.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the opinion paragraph below.

"Our school should allow students to bring water bottles into the classroom. Drinking water keeps our brains active and helps us think clearly during lessons. When students have water at their desks, they don't need to leave the room to use the fountain, which saves valuable learning time."

Which sentence best concludes this opinion paragraph?

answer_options.A: That's why allowing water bottles in class would help students learn better and save time.
answer_options.B: Water bottles are usually made of plastic or metal materials.
answer_options.C: Therefore, students should drink eight glasses of water every single day.
answer_options.D: That's why drinking water keeps our brains active.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because a strong concluding statement restates the opinion and summarizes the key reasons without adding new information. Option A synthesizes both reasons from the paragraph—thinking clearly (learning better) and saving time—while wrapping up the argument.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice describes a writing task that can be finished in a single sitting?

answer_options.A: A short poem about your favorite animal
answer_options.B: A research report on weather
answer_options.C: A class play script
answer_options.D: A biography of a famous athlete

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because writing a short poem is a brief task that can be completed quickly in one sitting, which aligns with the standard's description of writing in shorter time frames.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best demonstrates the skill described in W.3.10 at hard difficulty?

answer_options.A: The correct choice that matches the standard.
answer_options.B: An unrelated distractor option.
answer_options.C: A plausible but incorrect choice.
answer_options.D: Another distractor that does not apply.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it matches the skill described in the standard.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice shows a student following the writing goal of working on pieces that take different amounts of time and have different purposes?

answer_options.A: Tara writes a book review in one sitting and finishes a letter to her friend in twenty minutes, but she never spends several days planning or revising any projects.
answer_options.B: Marcus writes a thank-you note to his grandmother in one afternoon, and he spends the next week researching, drafting, and revising a state report to share at the fair.
answer_options.C: Ava works on a fiction story for ten days, adding details and fixing mistakes, but she does not write anything that takes less than a full day to finish.
answer_options.D: Jayden writes vocabulary sentences each morning for five minutes and only adds entries to his reading log when he finishes a book.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it shows a student writing a thank-you note in a single sitting (shorter time frame) and also working on a state report over a week with time for research, reflection, and revision (extended time frame), demonstrating writing routinely for different purposes and audiences.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best introduces a paragraph about caring for pet dogs?

answer_options.A: Pet dogs need fresh food, clean water, and daily exercise to stay healthy.
answer_options.B: Many people enjoy having dogs as pets.
answer_options.C: My dog likes to chase squirrels in the park.
answer_options.D: Dogs are mammals that have fur and four legs.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it introduces the topic of caring for pet dogs and groups related information together by mentioning food, water, and exercise as important needs.
subject: ELA

question:
A student is writing an informational report about how frogs grow and change. The student has these notes:
• Frogs begin as jelly-like eggs in the water.
• Tadpoles hatch with long tails and breathe with gills.
• Tadpoles slowly grow back legs, then front legs.
• The tail shrinks as the tadpole becomes a froglet.
• Adult frogs have lungs to breathe air and live on land.
• The whole change from egg to adult is called metamorphosis.
• A labeled diagram showing each stage helps readers see the transformation.

Which option best follows the rule: "Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension"?

answer_options.A: Start with "Frogs are born in water." Group facts into (1) "Eggs and Tadpoles" and (2) "Legs and Lungs." Add a cartoon frog wearing a crown.
answer_options.B: Start with "Frogs experience a fascinating metamorphosis, transforming from water-breathing swimmers to air-breathing hoppers." Group facts into (1) "Life Underwater" (eggs, gilled tadpoles) and (2) "Moving to Land" (growing legs, lung-breathing adults). Add a diagram showing the four stages labeled egg, tadpole, froglet, and adult.
answer_options.C: Start with "Some animals go through big changes." Group facts by (1) "Wet Things" (water, eggs, gills) and (2) "Dry Things" (land, air, lungs). Add a photograph of a pond with no frogs visible.
answer_options.D: Start with "First, the mother frog lays eggs." List all notes in order with no group headings. Add a picture of a tadpole swimming.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it introduces the topic clearly by naming the transformation process (metamorphosis), groups the related facts into logical sections that separate the water-dwelling stages from the land-transitioning stages, and includes a labeled diagram that specifically aids reader comprehension of the life cycle stages.
subject: ELA

question: A third-grader is beginning an informational article about honeybees. Which choice BEST introduces the topic, groups related information together, and suggests an illustration that would help readers?

answer_options.A: Honeybees are so cool! Last summer I saw a bee in my garden and it landed on a flower. Then I went inside to get lemonade.
answer_options.B: Honeybees are important insects that make honey and help plants grow. In this article, I will explain how bees build their hives, how they collect nectar, and why they are important to flowers. A diagram of a beehive would help readers see where the honey is stored.
answer_options.C: Honeybees buzz. Honeybees fly. Honeybees make honey. Honeybees live in hives. Honeybees have stripes.
answer_options.D: Honeybees, butterflies, and ants are all insects. This article will tell you about insects that fly, insects that crawl, and insects that sting.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it clearly introduces the topic (honeybees), groups related information together by previewing specific categories (hive building, nectar collection, and importance to flowers), and suggests a helpful illustration (a diagram of a beehive) to aid comprehension.
subject: ELA

question: Read this topic sentence from a report about honeybees: "Honeybees collect nectar from flowers to make honey." Which choice best develops this topic by adding a factual detail?

answer_options.A: I think honeybees are the most interesting insects in the world.
answer_options.B: Some flowers are red and others are yellow.
answer_options.C: Nectar is a sweet liquid inside flowers that bees turn into honey in their hive.
answer_options.D: Last summer, I saw a bee land on a flower in my garden.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it provides a factual detail that defines what nectar is and explains how bees use it to make honey, which directly develops the topic sentence with specific information.
subject: ELA

question: A student is writing an informative paragraph about honeybees. The topic sentence is: "Honeybees play a vital role in nature." Which choice best develops the topic with facts, definitions, and details?

answer_options.A: A honeybee is a flying insect that feeds on nectar; as it crawls inside blossoms, pollen grains cling to its hairy legs and rub off at the next bloom, allowing plants to produce fruit and seeds.
answer_options.B: Honeybees are amazing helpers that work tirelessly to support nature, and people everywhere admire their gentle spirit.
answer_options.C: Honeybees fly from flower to flower gathering food and helping things grow in gardens and fields.
answer_options.D: You can attract honeybees to your yard by planting lavender or sunflowers and providing a shallow water dish.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it develops the topic by providing a definition (a flying insect), a factual statement about feeding on nectar, and a specific scientific detail about pollen grains clinging to the bee's legs and rubbing off at the next bloom to explain how plants produce fruit and seeds.
subject: ELA

question: A student is writing an informative paragraph about rivers. Which choice best develops the topic with facts, definitions, and details?

answer_options.A: Rivers are beautiful and peaceful places to visit.
answer_options.B: A river is a large stream of freshwater that flows across the land toward an ocean, carrying soil and nutrients along the way.
answer_options.C: My family went swimming in a river during our vacation last summer.
answer_options.D: Rivers help the world in many different ways.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it provides a clear definition of a river, states a factual detail about where rivers flow, and includes specific information about what rivers carry, all of which develop the topic with concrete information rather than opinions or personal stories.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best completes the sentence to add another related idea? "Tom enjoys playing soccer. _____ he enjoys playing basketball."

answer_options.A: Also,
answer_options.B: But
answer_options.C: Because
answer_options.D: Then

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because "Also," is a linking word that adds another related idea about Tom's interests, connecting the two similar pieces of information about sports he enjoys.
subject: ELA

question:
A student is writing an informational paragraph about desert animals. The paragraph organizes information by how different animals stay cool. Which choice best fills in the blank in the THIRD sentence to use a linking word that connects ideas within the SAME category?

Draft:
1) Desert animals have special ways to beat the heat.
2) Fennec foxes have large ears that release body heat.
3) __________, they sleep in cool underground burrows during the day.
4) Camels have thick fur that protects them from the hot sun.

answer_options.A: However, they sleep in cool underground burrows during the day.
answer_options.B: For example, they sleep in cool underground burrows during the day.
answer_options.C: They also sleep in cool underground burrows during the day.
answer_options.D: As a result, they sleep in cool underground burrows during the day.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because the linking word 'also' connects the detail about sleeping in burrows as an additional way fennec foxes stay cool, joining it with the previous detail about their large ears. This linking word shows that both ideas belong to the same category of heat-release methods for this specific animal, creating a clear connection within the category rather than between different categories.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice best completes the sentence to connect the ideas about rainforests?

"Rainforests are home to many animals. _____, they produce much of the world's oxygen."

answer_options.A: But
answer_options.B: So
answer_options.C: Also
answer_options.D: Instead

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because 'Also' connects the two facts about rainforests (being home to many animals and producing oxygen) by adding information within the same category of rainforest characteristics.
subject: ELA

question:
Read this paragraph about robots. Which choice best concludes the paragraph?

Robots can help people in many ways. Some robots work in factories building cars and computers. Other robots explore dangerous places like deep oceans and outer space.

answer_options.A: Robots are made of metal and wires.
answer_options.B: That is why robots are useful tools for many jobs.
answer_options.C: Space is very cold and dark.
answer_options.D: Factories make many products.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it restates the main idea that robots help people and provides a concluding statement that wraps up the paragraph without introducing new details.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below.

"Earthworms are nature's recyclers. These small creatures live in soil and eat dead leaves and leftover plant material. As they digest this waste, they break it down into nutrients that enrich the dirt. Healthy soil full of nutrients helps new plants grow strong and tall. Gardeners often add earthworms to their gardens to improve the soil naturally."

Which choice would be the most effective concluding sentence for this paragraph?

answer_options.A: Some people buy earthworms at bait shops to use when they go fishing in the summer.
answer_options.B: All in all, earthworms play an important role in breaking down waste and creating healthy soil for plants.
answer_options.C: Earthworms have five hearts and breathe through their skin instead of lungs.
answer_options.D: Next, we will learn about other helpful insects that live in gardens and how to attract butterflies.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it restates the paragraph's central idea—that earthworms recycle waste and enrich soil to help plants grow—without introducing new information, providing a clear sense of closure to the informative text.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph below. Which sentence would be the BEST concluding statement for this paragraph?

"The water cycle is nature's way of recycling water. When the sun heats water in rivers and oceans, it turns into vapor and rises into the air. This vapor cools and forms clouds. Eventually, the water falls back to earth as rain or snow, starting the cycle all over again."

answer_options.A: Without the water cycle, living things could not survive on Earth.
answer_options.B: Water vapor is an invisible gas that floats in the atmosphere.
answer_options.C: Next, we will learn about different types of clouds.
answer_options.D: The ocean covers most of our planet's surface.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it provides a strong concluding statement that emphasizes the importance of the water cycle discussed in the paragraph. It wraps up the text by explaining why this process matters to living things, rather than introducing new details or shifting to a different topic.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best begins a story by introducing who is telling it and what is happening?

answer_options.A: The dark clouds gathered above the empty playground.
answer_options.B: The race finished and the winner crossed the line.
answer_options.C: I'm Carlos, and today I am walking to school in the rain.
answer_options.D: Rain is water that falls from clouds to the ground.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it introduces the narrator ("I'm Carlos") and establishes the situation ("today I am walking to school in the rain"), showing who is telling the story and what is happening as the story begins.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best establishes a situation, introduces the narrator or characters, and begins a natural sequence of events?

answer_options.A: On the shelf sat a mysterious box that seemed to vibrate with a low hum.
answer_options.B: Leo and I are best friends who love building spaceships in his garage, and we heard a strange buzzing sound yesterday.
answer_options.C: Yesterday afternoon, my best friend Leo and I were building a cardboard spaceship in his garage when we suddenly heard a strange buzzing sound coming from the tool shelf.
answer_options.D: Suddenly, a loud buzzing noise echoed through Leo's garage, and he looked at me with wide eyes.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it clearly establishes the situation (yesterday afternoon in the garage, building a cardboard spaceship), introduces both the narrator and the character Leo, and organizes the events so they unfold naturally (the characters are in the middle of an activity when the sound interrupts them).
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best begins a story by introducing the narrator, establishing the situation, and starting a natural sequence of events?

answer_options.A: Last night, the storm knocked out all the power in the neighborhood.
answer_options.B: I lit a candle and then the power suddenly went out while I was reading.
answer_options.C: Last night, I was reading on the couch when the power suddenly went out, so I stood up to look for a flashlight.
answer_options.D: My couch is brown and soft, and I like to read on it every day.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it introduces the narrator ('I'), establishes a clear situation (reading on the couch last night), and begins a natural sequence of events (the power goes out, so the narrator stands up to find a flashlight).
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best uses dialogue to show how a character feels?

answer_options.A: "I'm so excited!" yelled Mia, clapping her hands.
answer_options.B: Mia clapped her hands because she was excited.
answer_options.C: Mia felt very happy about the news.
answer_options.D: The news was written on a piece of paper.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it uses dialogue—Mia's exact words inside quotation marks—to show her excitement, combined with a description of her action (clapping her hands) to demonstrate her response.
subject: ELA

question:
Read this part of a story:

"The hike up the mountain was steeper than Luna expected. She stopped to rest."

Which option BEST uses dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to show Luna's response to the situation?

answer_options.A: "I can't take another step," Luna gasped, clutching her side. Her chest burned, and she wondered if reaching the top was really worth the pain.
answer_options.B: Luna stopped and clutched her side. Her chest burned, and she wondered if reaching the top was really worth the pain.
answer_options.C: "I can't take another step," Luna said. She stopped walking.
answer_options.D: Luna gasped and clutched her side while staring up at the mountain.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it includes dialogue ("I can't take another step,"), describes specific actions (gasped, clutching her side), and reveals Luna's thoughts and feelings (Her chest burned, she wondered if reaching the top was worth the pain). This combination fully develops the moment and shows her response to the difficult hike.
subject: ELA

question: Which sentence best shows what a character says and does to respond to a situation?

answer_options.A: "I can't find my dog!" shouted Mia as she ran through the park.
answer_options.B: Leo was worried about his lost cat.
answer_options.C: "We should build a fort," said Jake.
answer_options.D: The rain started to fall heavily.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it combines dialogue ("I can't find my dog!") with a description of action (ran through the park) to show how Mia responds to her missing dog.
subject: ELA

question:
Which choice best completes the sentence to show the order of events?

"First, we set the table. ________, we ate dinner."

answer_options.A: However
answer_options.B: Next
answer_options.C: Because
answer_options.D: Although

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because "Next" is a temporal word that clearly signals the next event in the sequence, showing that eating dinner happened immediately after setting the table.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph. It has five blanks.

[1] ________, the volunteers arrived at the park to clean up trash.
[2] ________, they divided into teams and assigned areas.
[3] ________, each group collected litter in their section.
[4] ________, they sorted the recyclables from the garbage.
[5] ________, the park looked beautiful and clean.

Which row of temporal words or phrases BEST completes blanks [1]–[5] so the events are shown in clear time order?

answer_options.A: First, Next, Meanwhile, After that, Finally
answer_options.B: To begin with, Subsequently, Then, Afterward, Finally
answer_options.C: Initially, Next, Earlier, Then, At last
answer_options.D: At first, Later, Previously, Next, Lastly

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses temporal words that consistently move the narrative forward in chronological order: 'To begin with' signals the start, 'Subsequently' indicates the following action, 'Then' marks the next step, 'Afterward' shows the subsequent event, and 'Finally' signals the conclusion.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice uses temporal words to show the correct order of events?

answer_options.A: I woke up late, and I missed the bus, and I walked to school.
answer_options.B: First, I woke up late. Next, I missed the bus. Finally, I walked to school.
answer_options.C: Because I woke up late, I missed the bus and walked to school.
answer_options.D: Finally, I woke up late. Next, I walked to school. First, I missed the bus.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it uses the temporal words "First," "Next," and "Finally" to clearly signal the chronological order of events: waking up late, then missing the bus, and then walking to school.
subject: ELA

question:
Jake spent all Saturday cleaning his messy room. He put away his toys, folded his clothes, and organized his bookshelf. When he finished, his floor was spotless.

Which choice best gives this story a sense of closure?

answer_options.A: Jake likes to play with his toys.
answer_options.B: Jake smiled, knowing he could find everything now.
answer_options.C: Jake's mom asked him to clean the kitchen next.
answer_options.D: He looked out the window and watched the rain.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it shows Jake's reaction to finishing his task and wraps up the story by suggesting he is happy with the result, which tells the reader the story is complete.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best demonstrates the skill described in W.3.3.D at hard difficulty?

answer_options.A: The correct choice that matches the standard.
answer_options.B: An unrelated distractor option.
answer_options.C: A plausible but incorrect choice.
answer_options.D: Another distractor that does not apply.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it matches the skill described in the standard.
subject: ELA

question:
Read the paragraph.

Emma practiced piano every afternoon for weeks. Her fingers stumbled over the keys at first, but she kept trying. At the school recital, she sat at the piano, took a deep breath, and played the song without a single mistake.

Which choice best ends the paragraph and provides a sense of closure?

answer_options.A: Emma smiled as the audience clapped, proud she had worked so hard.
answer_options.B: She started thinking about learning violin next month.
answer_options.C: The piano bench was made of dark brown wood.
answer_options.D: She began to wonder what song she would learn tomorrow.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it shows Emma reflecting on her accomplishment and feeling proud, which wraps up the story by highlighting the result of her hard work and providing a satisfying conclusion.
subject: ELA

question: Your teacher asks you to write instructions telling a friend how to plant a seed. Which choice best fits the task and purpose?

answer_options.A: Planting seeds is fun because you can grow flowers.
answer_options.B: First, put the seed in a cup of soil.
answer_options.C: I like to plant seeds with my mom on weekends.
answer_options.D: Seeds need water and sunlight to grow into plants.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it provides a clear, ordered step that tells the reader exactly what to do first, which fits the task of writing instructions and the purpose of explaining how to plant a seed.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing a formal letter to the town mayor requesting a new crosswalk near your school. Which choice best demonstrates writing with organization and development appropriate for this task and purpose?

answer_options.A: Dear Mayor Johnson, I am asking you to install a crosswalk near our school. The street is unsafe for kids. Please fix this problem as soon as possible. Thank you for your help. Sincerely, [Name]
answer_options.B: Dear Mayor Johnson, I am writing to request a crosswalk on Maple Street near our school. First, busy traffic creates danger for students walking alone. Second, a marked crosswalk would remind drivers to slow down. Third, our crossing guard supports this improvement. Please consider this request. Sincerely, [Name]
answer_options.C: Dear Mayor Johnson, Yesterday morning I walked to school. A red car zoomed past me very fast. I felt scared and breathless. My friend agreed it was dangerous. Please install a crosswalk soon. Sincerely, [Name]
answer_options.D: Dear Mayor Johnson, Crosswalks were first used in the 1950s in England. They help cars stop for people. Our school has five hundred students. A crosswalk would look nice. Please install one here. Sincerely, [Name]

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it demonstrates organization appropriate for a formal persuasive letter, including a respectful greeting, a clearly stated request, logically ordered reasons with specific supporting details (traffic danger, driver reminders, crossing guard support), and a polite closing. This structure aligns with the task of writing to an official and the purpose of persuading them to take action.
subject: ELA

question: You are writing an email to your school librarian to ask for help finding books about sharks for a research project. Which choice shows writing that is organized and appropriate for this task and purpose?

answer_options.A: Hi! Sharks are awesome. I want books about them. Do you have some? Bye.
answer_options.B: Dear Ms. Lee, I am doing a research project on sharks. Could you help me find books about great white sharks? Thank you, [Name]
answer_options.C: Sharks live in the ocean. They have fins and teeth. I need to write a report. Can you find me books?
answer_options.D: Dear Librarian, I like reading. Books are fun. Animals are interesting. Please help me find shark books today.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it includes an appropriate greeting, clearly states the purpose of the email, makes a specific request for books about great white sharks, and ends with a polite closing. This organization matches the task of writing a formal request to a school librarian for research assistance.
subject: ELA

question: Tomas wrote a story. His classmate points out that two words need capital letters, so Tomas fixes them. Which choice describes what Tomas is doing?

answer_options.A: Planning his story before writing
answer_options.B: Editing his draft with peer guidance
answer_options.C: Adding details to his characters
answer_options.D: Publishing his story in a book

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because fixing capital letters is part of editing for conventions, and Tomas is strengthening his writing with guidance from a peer (his classmate), which aligns with the standard's focus on editing with support from others.
subject: ELA

question: Liam wrote a draft about winning a soccer game: “the ball came to me. i kicked it hard. it went in the net. i felt happy. my team cheered.” Liam wants to strengthen his writing through revising and editing. Which choice best shows how he should improve his draft?

answer_options.A: Only fix the lowercase letters and add periods, without changing the short sentences.
answer_options.B: Combine the choppy sentences, add specific details about his excitement and the crowd's reaction, and correct the capitalization.
answer_options.C: Add the words “very” and “really” before “happy” and “hard” to make the sentences longer.
answer_options.D: Remove the first two sentences and start the story with the goal being scored.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it strengthens the writing by revising—combining the short, choppy sentences and adding specific descriptive details about feelings and reactions to improve clarity and engagement—while also editing to correct capitalization errors, thereby developing the writing as required.
subject: ELA

question: Lina wrote this paragraph in her journal: 'I went to the park. It was sunny. I played on the swings. I had fun.' Her writing partner suggests ways to make it stronger. Which suggestion best shows how to revise the writing by improving the ideas?

answer_options.A: Plan a different story about the beach.
answer_options.B: Add details about the sunny park and how the swinging felt.
answer_options.C: Check the spelling of each word carefully.
answer_options.D: Copy the paragraph in neat handwriting.

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because adding specific details about the setting and sensory experiences strengthens the writing by improving its content and clarity. This is an example of revising, which means changing the words and ideas to make the draft better.
subject: ELA

question: With help from a teacher, which choice shows using a computer to write a story, share it with others, and work together with classmates?

answer_options.A: Write a story in a notebook and read it to a friend
answer_options.B: Type a story on a computer, post it on the class blog, and comment on classmates' stories
answer_options.C: Draw a picture about a story and tape it to the wall
answer_options.D: Watch a video about storytelling on a tablet

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because typing on a computer uses keyboarding skills to produce the writing, posting it on the class blog publishes the writing for others to see, and commenting on classmates' stories shows interaction and collaboration.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best describes a student meeting the standard to, with adult guidance, use technology to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others?

answer_options.A: With her teacher's help revising the draft, Maya types her story on a laptop, shares it with classmates for feedback, and posts it on the class website.
answer_options.B: After writing his essay by hand, Ben asks his dad to type it and print copies for the family.
answer_options.C: Carla types her poem on a computer at home and emails the finished file only to her teacher.
answer_options.D: David types his report on the classroom tablet but keeps it in his drafts folder and does not share it.

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because it shows the student receiving guidance from an adult (teacher helps with revising), using keyboarding skills to produce writing (types on a laptop), interacting and collaborating with others (shares with classmates for feedback), and publishing the writing (posts on the class website).
subject: ELA

question: Which choice best shows a third-grader using technology to produce and publish writing while also interacting and collaborating with others, with guidance from a teacher?

answer_options.A: Carlos writes his essay by hand in a notebook and reads it aloud to his table group.
answer_options.B: Maya types her report on a computer, prints it, and places the only copy on her teacher's desk.
answer_options.C: Liam types his story on a laptop, uploads it to the class blog, replies to classmates' comments, and revises it with his teacher's help.
answer_options.D: Emma uses a voice app to record her story, saves it to her tablet, and listens to it by herself.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it shows Liam using keyboarding skills to produce writing, publishing it by uploading to a class blog where others can read it, interacting and collaborating with classmates through comments and replies, and receiving guidance and support from his teacher during the process.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice shows a student conducting a short research project to build knowledge about a topic?

answer_options.A: Writing a made-up story about a magical dragon from imagination
answer_options.B: Reading a book about planets and writing down four new facts learned
answer_options.C: Copying a paragraph from a website without reading or understanding it
answer_options.D: Drawing a picture of a favorite animal without looking up any information

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because conducting a short research project involves gathering information from sources such as books and recording facts to build knowledge about a topic.
subject: ELA

question: Marcus wants to do a short research project about thunderstorms to share with his class. He needs to build knowledge by finding facts from different places. Which choice shows the best way for Marcus to start his research?

answer_options.A: Marcus copies three paragraphs from the first website he finds and turns them in as his report.
answer_options.B: Marcus writes down five facts he already knows about rain and watches one video without writing anything new.
answer_options.C: Marcus finds one library book and one science website about thunderstorms, then writes down four new facts he learns.
answer_options.D: Marcus decides to research all weather on Earth, collects fifteen books about storms, but cannot finish reading any of them.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because it demonstrates how to conduct a short research project that builds knowledge: Marcus consults two different credible sources on his specific topic, actively reads to find new information, and records those new facts. This approach follows the research process by gathering information from multiple places and synthesizing what he learns.
subject: ELA

question: Which choice shows a student conducting a short research project that builds knowledge about a topic?

answer_options.A: Sofia looks at one photograph of a tiger and then writes a creative story about tigers in the jungle.
answer_options.B: Marcus asks his sister what she knows about space and writes down only her answer for his report.
answer_options.C: Ava reads two books about whales, watches a short documentary clip, and takes notes on what whales eat and where they live.
answer_options.D: Emma copies a paragraph from a website about dinosaurs without reading it or writing any notes.

answer_explanation: Option C is correct because Ava uses multiple reliable sources (two books and a documentary) and takes notes on specific facts, which demonstrates conducting a short research project to build knowledge about whales.
subject: ELA

question: Maria is writing a report about wolves. She took brief notes from a book and a website. She needs to sort her notes into two categories: "Where They Live" and "What They Eat." Which choice belongs in the "What They Eat" category?

answer_options.A: "Wolves live in forests and cold tundra."
answer_options.B: "Wolves hunt deer and rabbits."
answer_options.C: "Wolf pups are born in the spring."
answer_options.D: "Wolves have thick gray fur."

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because the note describes what wolves hunt and eat, which fits into the "What They Eat" category.
subject: ELA

question: A Grade 3 student is researching how animals survive winter. The teacher provided two categories for sorting evidence: 'Physical Adaptations' and 'Behavioral Adaptations.' The student gathers information from a library book, a national park website, and personal observations from a recent zoo visit. Which choice shows notes that BEST meet the requirements of W.3.8 for taking brief notes and sorting evidence?

answer_options.A: Book: 'The arctic fox has thick white fur that traps heat and it hunts small animals under the snow by listening carefully' sorted under Physical Adaptations; Website: 'Foxes dig tunnels to store extra food' sorted under Behavioral Adaptations; Personal: I watched a fox pouncing on snow at the zoo (not sorted)
answer_options.B: Book: Thick white fur traps heat (Physical Adaptations); Book: Hunts animals under snow (Behavioral Adaptations); Website: Dig tunnels to store food (Behavioral Adaptations); Personal: Watched fox pouncing at zoo (Behavioral Adaptations)
answer_options.C: Book: Hunts under snow (Physical Adaptations); Website: Thick fur traps heat (Behavioral Adaptations); Personal: Saw fox pouncing (Behavioral Adaptations)
answer_options.D: Book: Fur facts and hunting facts; Website: Storage facts; Personal: Zoo visit notes sorted into 'Body Changes,' 'Food Storage,' and 'My Trip'

answer_explanation: Option B is correct because it demonstrates brief notes rather than copied sentences, identifies the source for each note (Book, Website, or Personal observation), and accurately sorts every piece of evidence into the teacher's provided categories of 'Physical Adaptations' (fur) and 'Behavioral Adaptations' (hunting, digging tunnels, pouncing). Option A fails because it includes verbatim text that is too long and leaves the personal observation unsorted. Option C fails because it incorrectly sorts the book and website evidence—placing a hunting behavior under Physical Adaptations and a physical trait under Behavioral Adaptations. Option D fails because it creates new category names instead of using the provided 'Physical Adaptations' and 'Behavioral Adaptations' categories.
subject: ELA

question:
Zoe is writing a report about how animals stay safe. She gathered information from a book and a website, and she recalled her own experience. She wrote these brief notes:

1. "Rabbits hide in underground burrows. (Animal Survival, p. 12)"
2. "Turtles pull their heads into hard shells. (NatureKids.com)"
3. "I watched a deer run into the woods to escape a noise. (my experience)"

Zoe's teacher gave her two categories to sort her notes: "Uses a Shelter" and "Runs Away."

Which choice shows the correct way to sort Zoe's notes into the given categories?

answer_options.A: Put notes 1 and 2 in "Uses a Shelter" and note 3 in "Runs Away."
answer_options.B: Put all three notes in "Uses a Shelter."
answer_options.C: Put note 1 in "Uses a Shelter" and notes 2 and 3 in "Runs Away."
answer_options.D: Put notes 1 and 3 in "Uses a Shelter" and note 2 in "Runs Away."

answer_explanation: Option A is correct because Note 1 describes rabbits hiding in burrows, which is a shelter, and Note 2 describes turtles using their hard shells as protection, which is also a shelter. Note 3 describes a deer running into the woods to escape, which fits the "Runs Away" category. This demonstrates sorting brief notes from print sources, digital sources, and personal experience into the provided categories.
subject: ELA
